review_text: Honestly the only reason I bought this expensive screen "in my opinion" is for the story time feature to get to chat with my child in more interactive way, as he currently lives away from me. I notice there is only 6 stories you can not add to them, you can't create your own stories. the portal not having a battery was a big negative thing as I can't move it around freely. very limited Alexa application, the screen display of Alexa search results is limited to the weather, and answering some questions, you can't see order status with pictures, many of the screen features that Amazon Echo Show or even Echo Spot are missing, this is so disappointing I think enabling google home features to it as an option beside Alexa would be a big bonus, I know Google has a screen product but it has a very small, and with limited functions too. with children playing around it even with adult around having a lock screen feature comes very handy, as children may not be able to resist not touching the screen while story time is playing or during regular video call that most of the time will cancel the call. nevertheless I think portal has good potential to be a major player in both smart home and video calling and communication if those points are considered.

review_text: You'll need a FB account, an HDMI cable and the ability to not freak out over the super limited and vague instructions. Plug it in, follow the prompts and enjoy. We love ours. product_title: Facebook Portal - Smart Video Calling 10‚Äù Touch Screen Display with Alexa - Black
review_text: I have been so impressed by this device that I am writing my first review. I live in Chicago and my parents and sister in the UK. Mom is 88 and has been recently diagnosed with Alzheimer's and Dad is 90 and pretty fit and "mostly" with it, although has never used a touch screen before in his life. First I had to buy the folks a new cell phone that was able to download apps (they didn't have a smart phone) which was easy. Took their old one into the store where they bought it, upgraded to a Nokia 2.2 and they ported the number. Set that up with a new gmail address for Dad and downloaded Whats app. Didn't want to go the Facebook route as it seems like accounts get blocked if there is no other online presence, which there isn't. Added contacts to WhatsApp and tested all was working. Opened up the Portal. The 15" Plus is big. Obviously 15" screen, but then there's the base and camera on top, so close to 22" tall. The base is deep too (about 6" plus cable coming out of it, so placing on a mantelpiece probably won't work in most cases. Followed the on-screen instructions, connected to Wi-Fi and downloaded the latest software. Super easy. Next I added some contacts to favorites, and that was it. Increased font sizes, increased volume and done. What's great is that on the home screen, all that shows is the pictures of the favorite contacts. All Dad has to do it touch the screen, touch my icon, click video call and sit back. The call quality is amazing in both directions. They are both hard of hearing (Mum has two hearing aids) but have no problems with this. They can sit back in their chairs and still hear me, and I can hear them perfectly. I'd stopped calling them so often because it was so hard to get Mum to hear, now with this, I can chat every day. They don't have to hold a phone or worry about which buttons to press to put a phone on speaker. So simple and I can see how well they look (or not), see the flowers I sent etc. I still have can't believe the camera quality on this either. The way it widens to show the whole room when there's more than one person is incredible and when just one person is talking, it zooms in on them. Then widens when someone else joins the conversation. It's almost like being there. We have some care appointments set up for them this week and can't be there, but Dad will call us when the carer arrives and we can be in on the conversation. And yes, you can add other callers to the call, so both my sister and I can talk with Dad or the carer at the same time. I paid a little over the odds for it (not from Amazon) as I wanted it next day in the UK, but Amazon have it at a great price. Even at the price I paid, I'm totally satisfied. Sure it doesn't do that much, but what it does do, it does exceptionally well. If you're considering this as a tool to keep in touch with anyone, especially older folks, you won't regret it. Amazing!

product_title: Facebook Portal - Smart Video Calling 10‚Äù Touch Screen Display with Alexa - Black
review_text: I bought this to replace the echo show. Well, this device can't even function as a decent clock. The screen is designed to completely turn off after the device has been idle for some time. Max, the device screen can stay idle for 1 hour, and after that screen goes dark. So the clock and photos on the screen go dark after the device has been idle for more than an hour. One of the reasons, I wanted to have a digital display is to see the time, when I wake up in the morning or walk in the room. With the portal, you have to either touch the screen to bring it out of idle state or say "Hey portal tell the time". After multiple exchanges with support and research online, I learned that the only way to have a persistent clock is to keep the camera shutter ON all the time. That way device will know using the camera that there are motion and activity and it comes out of idle state to display time. This is a really 'SNEAKY' thing on the part of FACEBOOK to make customers keep the camera on. When Google, Amazon, and many other similar devices can continue to display the clock, and photos in the idle state with the camera off, why Facebook can't do the same way. The only useful feature of this device is the quality of video calls. The device has native support for video calls via WhatsApp, and Facebook messenger. The smart camera automatically pans, zooms, and follows the user. This is a neat feature but Google and Amazon will catch up to this feature soon. After a few days of use, and getting frustrated with it and Facebook support, the Echo Show is back in my home office and the portal is back on facebook shelves. Pros - Native support for Whatsapp video calls, Facebook and zoom - Smart Camera that automatically pans and zooms. Cons - Unusable clock and photo displays - Confusing user settings - Have to keep the camera ON for the device to detect motion
review_header: Poorly thought out product - Not an alternative for Amazon Echo or Google Home

review_text: Setup was a mess. Took forever to load update when I initially turned it on. Photos uploaded onto the app wouldn‚Äôt show up on frame. Customer service helped with a factory reset which was helpful. Then it wouldn‚Äôt sync up with WhatsApp and I had to remove my Facebook account to add my WhatsApp account. After finally getting it up and running 1.5hrs later (and I‚Äôm tech savvy) here are my takeaways: - this does not work well as a digital frame if that is your priority. Photo display is poor (especially for vertical photos) and dulls down the photo itself (you also cannot remove the clock in corner or info on when the photo was uploaded from the photo display feature) - Still trying to figure out where to position the frame in my kitchen so that the angle will capture young kids - lack of a battery means I can‚Äôt move it around - ‚Äúcinematography‚Äù isn‚Äôt generally that impressive - couldn‚Äôt locate apps like zoom until doing the factory reset with tech support All in all - they have not worked out the kinks in their systems. Rather unimpressed by this device now that I have it running. Probably great for a grandparent - but you‚Äôd have to set it up first then send.

I would‚Äôve saved my money and bought just a normal Alexa show had i known this. The Facebook video chats are very choppy and nowhere near as smooth as using our other devices for Facebook video chats. The device is also rather large so make sure you have a good space for it to sit. If you turn off the camera when not in use, it disables the microphone which stops the Alexa feature from working. Overall, the principle behind the portal is sound but not well executed.

review_text: Update 4/24/21: Zoom is finally here! Raising this by 1-star. Previous review: Honestly, I‚Äôm still looking for a good use for this. Right now, it‚Äôs mainly used as a TV cam for WhatsApp meetings and for that it works pretty ok. Fun that the camera tracks, easy even for my kids to initiate the call. Mic sometimes has trouble picking up speech in our medium sized living room. Often does not hear my voice commands from a working distance; have to come up closer to it to pick up. Apps are minimal and this won‚Äôt be replacing our other streaming boxes- we have a smart TV and Fire box- and numerous echoes in the house so I did not bother linking this to my Netflix or Amazon accounts; because this does not yet have the Disney+ or YouTube apps, I will continue to depend on the others. Word of caution: this currently does NOT support Zoom; so forget using this for Zoom family meetings. The Amazon description lists Zoom as a partner but appears this applies for the Portal and not Portal TV; Amazon really should have a separate description (indeed, and reviews) for both items. Camera works well, easy to set up but as others have said- update takes time. Had potential, but currently the functions seem rudimentary.

product_title: Facebook Portal - Smart Video Calling 10‚Äù Touch Screen Display with Alexa - Black
review_text: Nice features but lacking some basic things that would use practical. First off no way to answer whatsapp or messenger on phone and then transfer to portal TV. So annoying. Second it has this annoying red light when the mick is turned off. It should be blank when mic is turned off and only light up when in use. Also Portal Tv doesn‚Äôt support Zoom for some reason. Also often the Portal Tv images don‚Äôt load and it‚Äôs hard to know who you are calling. No power button so this device uses electricity even when not in use. Also the device will make a noise if an incoming call and no way to turn off which is annoying if someone sleeping in room. Should be able to disable and take calls on phone and optionally transfer to Portal Tv. But on the pro side: The Zoom and auto tracking is great - very wide angle and excellent if you have a room with many people including kids. Best feature of this device. Overall device is okay but the lacking features don‚Äôt make it practical for actual use. More a science experiment prototype right now rather than something mainstream that most people should consider.
review_header: Zoom is great but lacking a number of basic practical features

product_title: Facebook Portal - Smart Video Calling 10‚Äù Touch Screen Display with Alexa - Black
review_text: So far, here are the pros and cons.... Cons.... 1. Many of my messenger contacts were missing. After troubleshooting, I discovered that Portal TV has a 50-contact maximum (at least for Messenger, not sure about WhatsApp as I have less than 50 contacts for WhatsApp, but more than 50 on Messenger). So I was looking for certain people on Messenger and they were not listed, but you are able to manually search for them with the Search tool and then add them to your "Favorites" You can also "Hide" Contacts from your main Messenger or WhatsApp list, for people that you never video chat with. It Facebook/Portal did not inform the public or myself, the consumer, about the 50-contact limit, and this led to confusion of why many contacts were not showing up. Hopefully they will read this and increase the limit, or at least inform the users of the limit. 2. When using Messenger to call someone on iPhone, there was problem where it only viewed in Portrait mode and would not rotate to Landscape no matter what the iPhone user did. Then calling that same person through WhatsApp, Landscape worked perfectly. So seems like there is a Messenger orientation issue when other party is using iPhone. Pros... 1. Has been working as expected and really makes a huge difference, it is much more relaxed to be able to use your TV to video chat, you can just hang out and it is just so much better than using a little phone, especially when there are more people involved, so you don't have to huddle around little phones all the time. -I would have given 5 stars, but deducted one because of the 50-contact maximum limit that was never communicated by Facebook/Portal TV. *****UPDATE APRIL 20, 2020 -I originally gave it 4 stars, and am reducing to 2 stars. Every 3-4 weeks, it kicks you out of your account and you have to go to website on computer and enter code to re-authorize it. For my 75-year old mother, this confuses her and she calls me and it is very frustrating. Also, after spending 25 minutes creating a FAVORITES list of her WhatsApp contacts, Portal TV REMOVED them when it decided to kick her off her account for re-authorization, then the Favorites are gone and have to be re-created.
review_header: Portal TV...Has a 50-Contact Maximum Limit & U HAVE TO KEEP RE-SIGNING IN EVERY 3-4 WEEKS!

Any issue they ever had with it was external to the device (internet was out, power was not connected). When your portal TV is "ringing" it will make a sound and have a little light that will come on. The quality of the calls is good, however, it is subject to the quality of wifi callers have or data signal for those calling the portal using a phone connected via a cell tower. Camera quality is best in brightly lit rooms as with most cameras. I did have the benefit of setting it up and figuring it out for them in their home. When they bought a new TV it didn't have to be reconfigured, (plug and play). I was initially disappointed that this wasn't an all in one video calling and streaming entertainment system.

product_title: Facebook Portal - Smart Video Calling 10‚Äù Touch Screen Display with Alexa - Black
review_text: The sound quality is terrible! The device has many very sensitive microphones and uses these to control the video auto-tracking and point the camera at the person talking. BUT, they are too sensitive to give good sound quality. This will be an issue for anyone with any type of hearing difficulty as I have and requires those without any hearing difficulty to concentrate on the sound as reported by others in my family having some difficulty. The microphones pick up every echo and noise in the room and transmit it to the person on the other end of the internet. As a result, when I listen to anyone using a portal they sound like they are in a hollow room, or tin can, or have a blanket over their head. The portal and its software does not distinguish between echos off surfaces and has no noise cancellation. When the room people are in is large and/or has many hard surfaces it is worse but even when someone is in a normal size room with normal wall hangings and furniture it is still an issue. It has nothing to do with my sound system when I am listening to someone. I know this because the same thing was happening when we were on vacation at an Airbnb and now at home with 2 different sound systems. I know this because the tin can sound occurs only when someone in the conversation is using a portal and does not occur when the person at the other end of the call is using a phone or computer, or when one of my sons is using top of the line ear pods with built-in mic. Facebook needs to either - use the six mics to auto-track the cameras and use only one of the mics for the sound it transmits over the internet, use some intelligent software to process the sound, or use some kind of noise-canceling - or all three. I definitely do not recommend this for anyone with any kind of hearing difficulty. You will be greatly disappointed as I am.

product_title: Facebook Portal - Smart Video Calling 10‚Äù Touch Screen Display with Alexa - Black
review_text: I was excited to get my "brand-new" Portal. It was wrapped up like it was "brand-new", only it wasn't. It obviously was "pre-owned". Once I plugged it in, it did not take me to the "set-up" page, like in the instruction said. It did however have "Ronald's" account on the screen. I could not "set-up" my account or "reset" back to factory settings without "Ronald's" permission or password. "Who is Ronald?", you ask? Well, "Ronald" apparently, is who owned this Portal before me and returned it. Needless to say, I was very upset that I paid for a "brand-new" product but received a "used" product. - Yes, I finally found the contact information for Portal and they walked me through a factory reset without "Ronald's" information. I have used my Portal and like it very much. I guess that I just feel ripped-off that my Portal was not "brand-new", like it is described in the description. That's all!

product_title: Facebook Portal - Smart Video Calling 10‚Äù Touch Screen Display with Alexa - Black
review_text: I like many features about the amazon show like being able to see and edit shopping list and calendar. I love being able to face-time with my sister who also purchased an echo show. I hate it that I can't face-time with my son and daughter who both have Facebook portal. My son called my iPhone from a Facebook portal TV system and the difference was incredible. I need the echo show to talk with my sister, but I will definitively be getting a Facebook portal TV system. It is ridiculous that Facebook portal and Echo show don't have an app to let the two systems work with each other. It's would be like having a phone with one carrier and not being able to talk to somebody that uses a different carrier. If you and your loved ones don't have echo show or a face-book portal TV system, I would choose the face-book portal TV system. If you have loved ones who have the echo show, you will want to go with that because they don't work with each other.

product_title: Facebook Portal - Smart Video Calling 10‚Äù Touch Screen Display with Alexa - Black

product_title: Facebook Portal - Smart Video Calling 10‚Äù Touch Screen Display with Alexa - Black
review_text: Key problems: - Significant echo problems. Meant to work with a TV but can't track audio for voice cancellation. That's a BIG problem as the whole point is to not have to wear a headset. You can gain some traction by turning your TV *way* down and/or moving the portal far away from the TV, but that defeats the purpose as then you either can't hear or can't make eye contact (you're looking at the TV screen but the portal is far away from it, so others see the side of your head). Tech support will tell you to turn all external speakers off and turn audio way down. Sort of makes the whole thing useless, doesn't it? - Only works with Facebook Messenger. What if you have people in your life that don't use Facebook? You're sunk. No support for any other video chat systems. I get that Facebook wants to promote their own dog food, but there are a lot of people out there that don't want to use Facebook / don't have a Facebook account. All in all, more hassle than it's worth. If it worked well (no echo, audio usable, call people on other systems) it would be great. Instead, it's just frustrating.
review_header: Not as great as it could be.

product_title: Facebook Portal - Smart Video Calling 10‚Äù Touch Screen Display with Alexa - Black
review_text: This was wonderful the first month. It then began showing a message stating ‚Äúno connection to wifi‚Äù. All other wifi connections: kindle fires, etc were connecting without a problem. Spoke with tech support and troubleshooted everything they suggested. We were finally given a phone number and told to call for a assignment number. We were told we would be given an address to return the portal. These actions began in April. It is now the end of Nov. We have had two responses assigning a number and nothing since June despite monthly emails to tech support. Having the portal was an extremely urgent need. For those of you who are having a great experience with the product we envy you. For an answer for an urgent problem it was a total failure.

I did have it run it through the Yamaha receiver for sound as all options to run audio through the tv were mute (pun intended). No echo, no delay, and the 13 megapixel camera is really nice.

product_title: Facebook Portal - Smart Video Calling 10‚Äù Touch Screen Display with Alexa - Black
review_text: We absolutely love our Portal! It feels like our kids and grandkids are right in the room with us!!!!

product_title: Facebook Portal - Smart Video Calling 10‚Äù Touch Screen Display with Alexa - Black
review_text: I WANT to love this thing, but they make it sooo hard... As we've made the purchases we push through and use, and enjoy them... but I'd be hesitant to really recommend someone buy one... Next Generation maybe? Positives: Bought these for myself, mom, and sister, and father in law... We use it almost every weekend and love how it connects the family. We have young kids and the grandparents get to see them run around, and now the kids recognize their voice etc. After you're done its ALMOST like you sat next to them on the couch and had a good chat... Now very good during COVID isolation as well... The AR is fun for kids and adults and the story time thing is cool. Negatives: They had such a strong chance for a GREAT product, but the negatives are almost to the point where I'd be iffy about actually recommending this to someone. Making and Connecting on calls - Linking up multiple people is for some unknown reason, always a pain... You can sign in through Facebook Messenger AND/OR WhatsApp... BUT if you want too add people to calls they need to be signed into the same thing (Messenger or Whatsapp), and you can only ADD someone to call, you can't combine a received call... I bought the ones that hookup to your TV, so I'll admit this is partially due to that, but you effectively need to call ahead, make sure everyone has their TV's to the right input, and is signed into the right service. As my sister said this morning, you come near to starting a family fight while trying to get the call going asking why someone isnt signed into the right service (see below). Also while combining calls (specifically for having 3 people on a call, it just shows the middle of the field of view of the camera and cuts off the sides... My mom inevitably can only see me in the center of the picture and misses my kids running around, and I in turn see my mom well centered, but only see my sisters cat which is situated between her and her husband... Set-up - It should be easy, but its not... Initial set up is KIND OF intuitive, but its not as simple as many other things... Its not impossible, and even after initial set up things don't always seem to stick... I (the tech knowledgeable 30 something) inevitably spend sometime face-timing or phoning the person on the other end to help them re-sign into something (even I've experienced being randomly signed out of profiles). Image Quality, Zoom, and following - We're all used to HD or 4K... and this is definitely not that quality... In a wide field of view the 12 mp camera does fine BUT when it "Zooms" in on you its only digital zoom so picture quality degrades quickly... The camera follows you nicely for big motions but sometimes seems to kind of have some ADD and randomly goes "Squirrel!" and zooms to another part of the room or just decides it doesn't like someone and won't include them in the picture... You can choose someone for the camera to focus on, but honestly having the OPTION just being able to manually control where the camera is looking would be super nice.. AR only tracks (3) faces which is kinda lack luster... even in a family of 4 someone is left out...
review_header: I WANT to love this thing, but they make it sooo hard...

product_title: Facebook Portal - Smart Video Calling 10‚Äù Touch Screen Display with Alexa - Black
review_text: Hi. We tried for hours to get this to work with a smart tv with external speakers but the caller always had an echo that made the calls completely unusable. This problem seems unsolved based on many online complaints. I would not recommend if you have external speakers. Also it is quite limited to facebook conferencing apps which forces you to use those accounts. The video quality was exceptional on a 4k tv and the built in tracking was great (it followed people as they moved around the kitchen for example). A great view into the future but hopefully someone will fix the audio problems and make a more open system.
review_header: Does not work with external speakers - echo
